cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 320 mi SSW of the mouth of the Mississippi River and 355 mi SSW of New Orleans, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating north then north-northeast toward the northern Gulf Coast, crossing southeastern Louisiana this afternoon and racing inland across Mississippi and Alabama tonight
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana (around Port Fourchon–Grand Isle area)

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch west of Morgan City to Intracoastal City, LA (west of the port)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from the Mississippi/Alabama border to the Walton/Bay County Line, FL; Storm Surge Warning from the mouth of the Atchafalaya River, LA to Navarre, FL including Mobile Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeastern Louisiana eastward through coastal Mississippi and Alabama to the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–73 mph) likely with gusts possibly reaching minimal hurricane force as the core passes this evening
weather_observation.storm_surge: 4–6 ft of inundation possible in Mobile Bay with large, dangerous waves on open coastal exposures
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches, locally up to 6 inches, leading to flash and urban flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: A few tornadoes possible this afternoon and tonight as rainbands move ashore
